channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The pavement is filthy and stained and is currently covered in a pile of abandoned clothes, 29th June
item.description:
The pavements on Seven Sisters Road, station place, Blackstock Road and Stroud Green are filthy, covered in stains and need a thorough power wash clean. The specific point highlighted on the map currently has a large pile of filthy clothes. Rubbish bins from shops and takeaway restaurants are left directly on the pavement, smelling horribly and are a disgraceful mess
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Stroud Green Road, Stroud Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Haverstock Hill junction with Eton Road, 29th June
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 8EZ outside number 93 (nex, 29th June
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 8EZ outside number 93 (next to Idmiston Rd junction) are a couple of cycle parking hoops. One dumped cycle chained to a hoop â€“ both wheels missing. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to show location pin and picture to your action team.

item.title: 226 Grafton Road, 29th June
item.description:
CCTV camera still not replaced. Reported 10 April. Cars still driving through no entry signs. Council responsibility. Escalating to Cllrs as you are pretending this is not the responsibility of the Council. Please explain who is responsible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 234, Grafton Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet
